topic.title: Fixing languages in ZeroNet
topic.body:
- Rename `jp.json` files to `ja.json` because there is **no such language code** as **jp**!
- Rename all `zh.json` files to `zh-hans.json` (Chinese **S**implified)
- Rename all `zh-tw.json` files to `zh-hant.json` (Chinese **T**raditional) 

Regarding `zh-tw` I must say that Taiwan is not a separate country from China and traditional Chinese also written in Hong-Kong, Macau and other Chinese territories. Using the `zh-tw` language code is wrong (I even consider it as Sinophobic) and goes against the recommendation of the World Wide Web Consortium which strongly recommends to use `zh-hant` instead.

topic.title: Fixing templates
topic.body: I have added two **missing body element** and **moved a style element to the head** section from body.

topic.title: Codemirror exponential regexp (UiFileManager)
topic.body:
I was playing around beautifying css and js in UiFileManager's codemirror when I noticed that they fixed the following: 
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/2635/commits/f093a3f4cacaefbd3bdc3a0a50afc7ad207c78e7

In my opinion other way to update codemirror is needed in order to avoid this and similar issues in the future.

topic.title: Adding OGG MIME
topic.body: .ogg is **not listed** in the mimetypes module: https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/3.9/Lib/mimetypes.py and since **we don't know whether the ogg file contains audio or video**, we need an `application/ogg` mime for those files with the `.ogg` extension.

topic.title: Migrate zeronet, restore users.json will fail.
topic.body:
Migrating the content of the users.json namely the site address and the corresponding private key to a new user.json file while leaving out master_seed, auth_address, and auth_privatekey will result in the following error while signing:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "zeronet.py", line 18, in main
    main.start()
  File "/path/src/main.py", line 767, in start
    actions.call(config.action, action_kwargs)
  File "/path/src/main.py", line 174, in call
    back = func(**kwargs)
  File "/path/src/main.py", line 293, in siteSign
    site_data = user.getSiteData(address)
  File "/path/src/User/User.py", line 91, in getSiteData
    self.generateAuthAddress(address)
  File "/path/src/util/Noparallel.py", line 75, in wrapper
    raise (err)
  File "/path/src/util/Noparallel.py", line 68, in wrapper
    res = func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/path/src/User/User.py", line 68, in generateAuthAddress
    auth_privatekey = CryptBitcoin.hdPrivatekey(self.master_seed, address_id)
  File "/path/src/Crypt/CryptBitcoin.py", line 61, in hdPrivatekey
    privatekey_bin = sslcurve.derive_child(seed.encode(), child % 100000000)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'encode'
---
```

Master seed is not used by me at all so having requirement to use it in users.json makes no sense. Now what? I will pull out the master seed from thin air? Hmm @imachug ?

topic.title: Complete list of binary extensions
topic.body:
This definitely will fix the issue https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/2656 
Thanks to @imachug https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/2656#issuecomment-713442004 for pointing me to this line. :+1:

1604068009_mirrored_JabbaDesilijicTiure_.body:
@imachug actually Mozilla also referring to `zh-hans` and `zh-hant`: 
https://github.com/mozilla/language-mapping-list/blob/6a1ba99f9625486705f0872750df228f52498bea/language-mapping-list.js#L837

The latest `RFC5646` obsoleted ~~RFC4646~~. 
Quotes from https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646#appendix-A are below:

Simple language subtag:
>  ja (Japanese)

Language subtag plus Script subtag:
> zh-Hant (Chinese written using the Traditional Chinese script)
> zh-Hans (Chinese written using the Simplified Chinese script)

RFC should be followed not the practices of corporations or other projects. In my opinion using `zh-hans-cn` (Language-Script-Region format) makes no sense since in China both Traditional and Simplified Chinese are used today. 
It is enough to use Language subtag plus Script subtag: either `zh-hant` or `zh-hans`.

> This looks like a bug in the application: it seems to be returning a generator as one of the elements of its response, instead of a byte string. The response itself can be a generator, but [the values yielded by it must be byte strings](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/#specification-details):
> 
> > When called by the server, the application object must return an iterable yielding zero or more bytestrings
